intro: Cerinthe lurida, commonly known as the pale horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its striking, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Cerinthe lurida is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species.
